label: Petition from Margaret Lowrey to the St. Andrew's Society
description: Petition of Margaret Lowrey to the St. Andrew's Society requesting to be compensated for her midwife services, explaining that she has been denied payment by Elizabeth Allen, a yearly recipient of the society's charity.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Petition of Margaret Lowrey to the St. Andrew's Society requesting to be compensated for her midwife services, explaining that she has been denied payment by Elizabeth Allen, a yearly recipient of the society's charity.

metadata.label: Access Note
metadata.value: For more information contact Special Collections, College of Charleston Libraries, 66 George St., Charleston SC 29401.

metadata.label: Digitization Specifications
metadata.value: 300 dpi, 24-bit depth, color. Epson Expression 10000XL. Archival masters are tiffs.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
To the Honourable John Clelland Esqr. President and other Officers and Members of the St. Andrew's Club --

Whereas your humble Petitioner Margaret Lowrey, is informed that one Elizabeth Allen has Some Relief paid her yearly from your Club, and I was her maidwife [midwife] some more than a year ago, and Deliver'd her Safely, and instead of her paying me my Lawfull [lawful] fees when I made a Just Demand, only Treated me with bad Language not fitt [fit] here to Mention and as I am a poor Woman my Self, and my husband not well able to work, I Should be forever bound in Duty to wish well to every Member of the honourable Club to See me paid as I never was nor never Desire to be bourdensome [burdensome] to any Society whatsoever, but willing to Live Contented with my Lawfull [lawful] Endeavours, This is all from your well wisher and Petitioner

Charles Town 8th Decembr 1755

metadata.label: Collection Title
metadata.value: St. Andrew's Society of Charleston Records, 1729-2001
